citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
The current written Program of Veterinary Care does not include the avian species: 1 great horned owl, 3 African Grey
parrots, and 5 chickens. The program of veterinary care should include standards of care for all regulated species that are
exhibited. The facility written program of veterinary care must be updated by the attending veterinarian to ensure the birds
receive the appropriate diagnosis and treatment of health conditions. Correct by October 30, 2023.

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
The birds at the facility were appropriately housed and provided with materials and activities to enhance their
environment. However, a written plan to include these provisions to improve the well-being of the birds had not been
developed and approved by the Attending Veterinarian.
Per this Section, exhibitors must develop, document, and follow a species-appropriate plan for environment enhancement
to promote the psychological well-being of birds. The plan must be must be in accordance with currently accepted
professional standards as cited in appropriate professional journals or reference guides. At a minimum, the plan must
address each of the following: social grouping, environmental enrichment, special considerations, restraint devices, and
exemptions (if applicable). A written environmental enrichment plan, appropriate for the species of birds maintained, must
be developed and approved by the Attending Veterinarian. Correct by October 30, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
2.40(a)(1) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
The current written Program of Veterinary Care does not include the avian species: 1 great horned owl, 3 African Grey 
parrots, and 5 chickens. The program of veterinary care should include standards of care for all regulated species that are 
exhibited. The facility written program of veterinary care must be updated by the attending veterinarian to ensure the birds 
receive the appropriate diagnosis and treatment of health conditions. Correct by October 30, 2023. 
3.154 
   
Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being. 
The birds at the facility were appropriately housed and provided with materials and activities to enhance their 
environment. However, a written plan to include these provisions to improve the well-being of the birds had not been 
developed and approved by the Attending Veterinarian. 
 
Per this Section, exhibitors must develop, document, and follow a species-appropriate plan for environment enhancement 
to promote the psychological well-being of birds. The plan must be must be in accordance with currently accepted 
professional standards as cited in appropriate professional journals or reference guides. At a minimum, the plan must 
address each of the following: social grouping, environmental enrichment, special considerations, restraint devices, and 
exemptions (if applicable). A written environmental enrichment plan, appropriate for the species of birds maintained, must 
be developed and approved by the Attending Veterinarian. Correct by October 30, 2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
